Uses of Class
Main.Models.Brick

Packages that use Brick
Package Description
Main.ModelsTest
This package contains the test files for testing the models of the game.
Main.MVC
This package holds the java files related to the MVC design pattern.
Main.Others
This package holds the other java classes which cannot be clearly fitted into another package.

  • Uses of Brick in Main.ModelsTest

    Fields in Main.ModelsTest declared as Brick
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Brick BrickTest.brick
    Brick object used in the tests.

  • Uses of Brick in Main.MVC

    Fields in Main.MVC declared as Brick
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Brick[][] GameBoard.bricks
    This is the double array of Bricks to hold the bricks generated for all 5 levels.
    private Brick[][] GameBoardController.bricks
    This is the double array of Bricks to hold the bricks generated for all 5 levels.
    Methods in Main.MVC that return Brick
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Brick[][] GameBoard.getBricks()
    This method returns the double array of Bricks.
    Methods in Main.MVC with parameters of type Brick
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void GameBoardRenderer.drawBrick​(Brick brick, java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
    This method is used to draw the bricks by filling inner colour and drawing outer colour.
    int GameBoardController.findImpact​(Ball b, Brick brick)
    This method checks to see if impact occurs between the ball and brick.
    private boolean GameBoardController.impact​(Brick b)
    This method causes an impact to the brick if the random probability is less than the damage probability.
    private void GameBoardController.makeCrack​(java.awt.geom.Point2D point, int direction, Brick b)
    This method creates a crack from the impact point in the given direction.
    private void GameBoardController.makeCrack​(java.awt.Point start, java.awt.Point end, Brick b)
    This method creates a crack from the impact point to the randomly selected end point.
    void GameBoardController.repair​(Brick b)
    This method is used to repair the bricks by setting their broken flag to false and resetting their strength.
    boolean GameBoardController.setImpact​(java.awt.geom.Point2D point, int dir, Brick b)
    This method is used to check if an impact occurs with a brick.
    private void GameBoardController.updateBrick​(Brick b)
    This method appends the new crack to the brick and updates the brick face.

  • Uses of Brick in Main.Others

    Methods in Main.Others that return Brick
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private Brick[] LevelGeneration.makeAllLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickRow, int level)
    This method controls the generation for all the custom levels and returns an array of Bricks for a custom level.
    private Brick LevelGeneration.makeBrick​(java.awt.Point point, java.awt.Dimension size, int type)
    This method is used to create a brick of a certain type with a given size at a given point.
    private Brick[] LevelGeneration.makeChessboardLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int typeA, int typeB, int level)
    This method is used to generate an array of 31 bricks in 3 lines.
    Brick[][] LevelGeneration.makeCustomLevels​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea)
    This method is used to create 5 levels to be loaded into the game.
    private Brick[][] LevelGeneration.makeDefaultLevels​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea)
    This method creates the 5 default levels and loads them into a double array of Bricks.
    private Brick[] LevelGeneration.makeSingleTypeLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea)
    This method is used to generate an array of 31 bricks in 3 lines, all of which are the same type.
